document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Acylophorus Nordmann, 1837 from Madagascar and Mascarene Islands (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylininae: Acylophorina)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Acylophorus Nordmann, 1837 from Madagascar and Mascarene Islands (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylininae: Acylophorina)

bibRefCitation.refString: Jarrige, J. (1965) Les Acylophorus malgaches (Col. Staphylinidae). Bullettin de la Societ entomologique de France, 70, 139 - 143.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Madagascar , Mahanilazy [ Mananilazy ] near Ambatondrazaka.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined. Paratypes :
“

2017” ( MHNP ); 1 ♂ : “Perinet”, “ sogai ”, “ PARATYPE ”, “ PARATYPUS Acylophorus sogai Jarrige, J. Janák rev. 2017” ( MHNP );

MADAGASCAR , Beforona commune
, 12.vi.2012 , Tsitiavary VOHIMANA, sifting litter, S18°54’59.8‘‘E48°30’50.1‘‘, 732m , Winkler app. extraction; L.S.Rahanitriniaina & E.M. Rabotoson lgt. (JJRC, MMBC).

Redescription (n=10). Body length 7.1–9.5 mm (M=8.0 mm), forebody length 3.0– 3.5 mm (M= 2.2 mm ) ( Fig. 151 ). Body black or dark brown, pronotum and elytra brown, abdominal tergites moderately iridescent; antennae reddish brown with base of first segment and segments 7–11 reddish yellow; legs and maxillary palpi reddish brown, tarsi reddish yellow.
Female. Posterior margin of tergite slightly emarginate ( Fig. 164 ), valves as in Fig. 165 .

Differential diagnosis.
Acylophorus sogai
differs from the remaining species of
A. salifi
group mainly by the median lobe only slightly overreaching the paramere. The species differs from Madagascan species of the
A. salifi
group with similar body shape by larger body and longer fourth antennal segment.
Distribution . The species is distributed in East, Central and North Madagascar .

Bionomics .
Acylophorus sogai
was collected by sifting of forest litter and also by treading on banks of streams, ponds or lakes ( Fig. 168 ).
Discussion. The type locality “Mahanilazy” as published by Jarrige (1965) is written on paratypes label as Mananilazy.
